title: Barstowite
text:
Barstowite, formula Pb4[Cl6|CO3]•H2O, is a transparent to white mineral in the <a href="monoclinic">monoclinic</a> system. It has a <a href="Mohs%20hardness">Mohs hardness</a> of 3, a white <a href="Streak%20%28mineralogy%29">streak</a> and an adamantine <a href="Lustre%20%28mineralogy%29">lustre</a>.
The <a href="Type%20locality%20%28geology%29">type locality</a> for Barstowite is Bounds Cliff, <a href="St%20Endellion">St Endellion</a>, <a href="Cornwall">Cornwall</a> in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>. It is named after <a href="Richard%20W.%20Barstow">Richard W. Barstow</a> (1947–1982), a Cornish mineral collector.
